evidence.snippet: drain within the pipe. Drain snake/auger: Another manual tool, this one is a flexible metal cable coiled inside a drum. Drain snakes are best for removing clogs located deeper in the drain system and work on toilets, kitchen and bath sinks, tubs, and showers. evidence.snippet: THE DRAIN SNAKE METHOD tap here to view video MATERIALS small bowl or bucket, rag, 1/8 hand auger (drain snake), utility knife 1  If you’ve not already removed the P-trap, follow steps 1–3. 2  With the trap off, place the end of the snake down the drain pipe.
